name: Dodecahedral conjecture
rephrased: In any packing of identical spheres, the volume of the space surrounding a single sphere is minimized when the shape of that space is a regular dodecahedron.
implication_form: If there exists a packing of unit spheres in three-dimensional Euclidean space, then the volume of the Voronoi cell associated with any sphere is at least the volume of a regular dodecahedron with inradius one.
explained: The Dodecahedral Conjecture states that in any packing of congruent unit spheres in three-dimensional Euclidean space, the volume of the Voronoi cell associated with each sphere is at least the volume of a regular dodecahedron with an inradius of one.
